text: .@FERC accepted and suspended tariff revisions filed by Trailblazer Pipeline Company LLC proposing “rate increases as well as several tariff changes related to the removal of Rate Schedule FTB” and other revisions. #natgas #pipelines https://t.co/cq50btd0a3

.@FERC granted an application filed by Transcontinental Gas Pipe Line Company, LLC “requesting authorization to construct and operate the Southeast Supply Enhancement Project.” #natgas #pipelines https://t.co/HttyV2hCQc
.@FERC granted a petition filed by Enbridge (U.S.) Inc. “to update and replace its existing limited waiver of the No-Conduit Rule adopted in Order No. 787.” #natgas #pipelines https://t.co/D2PMBeqEH1
Here are the 21 orders @FERC published last week (February 9-13, 2026). #FERCweekly https://t.co/5VMZsNXmqd

.@FERC Chief ALJ granted an unopposed motion filed in a proceeding involving DCR Transmission, L.L.C. seeking an extension of the procedural schedule, including “an 89-day extension of the current initial decision deadline.” #FERC #energy https://t.co/ypAbQneWHL
.@FERC Chief ALJ granted a motion filed by Colonial Pipeline Company seeking “an approximately nine-week extension of most of the procedural schedule dates.” #FERC #energy https://t.co/qbLttDR1R4

.@FERC ALJ granted a motion filed by Marathon Petroleum Canada Trading & Supply ULC to compel Mustang Pipe Line LLC “to produce unredacted responses to several of Marathon’s First Set of Data Requests.” #FERC #energy https://t.co/BU89VEGUbj

.@FERC conditionally accepted a tariff revision filed by Colonial Pipeline Company “to reflect proposed modifications to its capacity allocation program (CAP) structure and fees and its nomination integrity program (NIP) structure and fees.” #FERC #energy https://t.co/ijPEzEBVKI
Here are the 20 orders @FERC published last week (February 2-6, 2026). #FERCweekly https://t.co/U8N18y1zSY

.@FERC accepted proposed tariff revisions filed by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. “to establish a separate... process for Replacement Generation Interconnection Service Requests to facilitate the transfer of Capacity Interconnection Rights.” #FERC #energy https://t.co/kyF4qWPWI9

.@FERC issued Order No. 916, a final rule transferring delegations from the previously disbanded Office of Energy Policy and Innovation to the Office of Technical Reporting and Economics as well as the Office of General Counsel. #FERC #energy https://t.co/DFH4Dc4wF8

.@FERC ALJ denied a motion filed by Commission Trial Staff “requesting authorization of virtual depositions” in a proceeding involving Northern Natural Gas Company. #FERC #natgas #energy https://t.co/ZtxpelFKBD
.@FERC accepted an unexecuted Multi-Party Facilities Construction Agreement filed by Midcontinent Independent System Operator, Inc. #FERC #energy https://t.co/h4OZxCQEE5

.@FERC Executive Director issued a final rule updating the Commission’s filing fees for 2026, based on fiscal year 2025 costs, to be effective February 19, 2026, 30 days following publication in the Federal Register. #FERC #energy https://t.co/YvGmONrdTC

.@FERC dismissed requests for rehearing and and denied requests for clarification filed by Powerex Corp and Western Power Trading Forum in response to the Commission’s August 29, 2025 PacifiCorp EDAM Order. #FERC #energy https://t.co/mtf3sIgFsK

.@FERC dismissed requests for rehearing and denied requests for clarification filed by Powerex Corp and Western Power Trading Forum in response to the Commission’s August 29, 2025 Portland EDAM Order. #FERC #energy https://t.co/TpDdYaGxT2
.@FERC ALJ granted a motion filed by Commission Trial Staff seeking a “shortened answer period, and expedited consideration.”  #FERC #energy https://t.co/KDIYxPiGNW
Here are the 44 orders @FERC published last week (January 26-30, 2026). #FERCweekly https://t.co/z9YjZ7BdMX

.@FERC responded “to a November 18, 2021, order of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit by documenting our dismissal of the agency proceedings that were the subject of that order, as discussed below.” #natgas #pipelines https://t.co/Aaa48Ij3zd

.@FERC granted a joint petition filed by Cygnet Energy Ltd., Kiwetinohk Energy Corp., and Kiwetinohk Marketing US Corp., requesting “temporary and limited waiver of certain Commission capacity release regulations and policies.” #natgas #pipelines https://t.co/cdKoU6eTiG
